reviews.sentence: Great staff thin walls. The front desk staff was so friendly. The beds are small they seem to be somewhat smaller than double size. My main complaint is the walls were super thin. I woke up several times from hearing conversations of others and could hear next door rooms tv clearly.
Excellent hotel. The staff were very friendly and greated you at the door. The hotel itself was exceptionally clean and comfortable.

Here for convention beautiful upgrades great staff easy access to much. A great venue for a meeting. Conference center excellent spacious clean easy to walk over to. Newly renovated rooms are amazing. Fridge safe all the amenitites one needs. Staff ultra friendly and helpful. Much shopping food etc in walking distance to hotel. Only 62 mi from Port Columbus airport. Very nice. Highly suggested stay.
Beautiful hotel great service plenty of activities amazing breakfast.

Ignore the negative reviews this hotel is really lovely. I visited the Hilton Columbus at Easton for a second time previously over Christmas 2012. It is a luxury that I question. I fly to Ohio to visit my Sis and stay at Hilton Easton a few days before going home because it is expensive. SO worth it. I have read reviews from people who were staying here the same time as me and question their issues. The rooms are exceptionally clean and since my last visit newly decorated I was pleased to see a shower not a bath. Housekeeping do an amazing job. Likewise room service is outstanding. At all times when I left my room whether to lay out in the sun sit by the pool or just leave the hotel to shop the staff went out of their way to say hello. They were incredibly pleasant and it was lovely to see smiles. Other reviews around the time I stayed state they could not sleep this is nonsense I slept well staff were around cleaning from 7 am which is to be expected but there was no noise from other rooms etc. I fly 22 hours to visit my sis in Coshocton and stay at Easton a few nights before my journey home. Will I return. Without doubt. Please disregard the negative reviews I am very particular and still rate my stay as the ultimate luxury. Thank you for making me so welcome.

Columbus Hilton. Great hotel. Excellent location to interstate shopping night life and casino. Excellent food and service. Helpful staff. Beautiful interior and exterior. Clean hotel both in and out. Lobby seating is plentiful and comfortable.

Great location classic hotel service good food. This is a beautiful hotel with all the expected upscale services. The facility is well cared for and properly staffed. The lobby is large classy and welcoming with the fireplace burning on a chilly evening. Parking is easy and ample. The rooms are large and well appointed. You could have a great visit using the hotel bars and restaurants and never leave the building. We had a large traditional and delicious breakfast in the dining room with fine service. But the best asset of all is that the hotel is within walking distance of several very good restaurants in the Easton Mall area so you can have good dining and add that extra Martini or glass of wine then slowly walk back to the hotel without fear of a DUI citation. This is in many ways like the old downtown hotels of years ago surrounded by neat shops and restaurants. The holiday decor in the Easton area is beautiful so go and have a fun and nostalgic holiday shopping adventure. This is a very nice hotel. Not cheap but worth it for the level of ambiance service and comfort they provide.

Weirdest Massage Ever. In my last review I mentioned that I would like this location to offer massage services. Prior to my arrival I called the concierge for recommendations for a nearby spa and was told they now offer massages on site. I was THRILLED. Unfortunately I am not sure what kind of screening process they use to find their therapists but they need to come up with a better way. There is no way this woman was a licensed therapist. I would think that in a hotel like this an LMT would audition for the job by providing massages to those hiring. The tiny lady met me at the massage room outside the workout area and I was disappointed that some of the noises outside the door were quite audible. This turned out to be the least of my concerns. She offered me a small selection of relaxation music. Frank Sinatra Pavarotti or one called Escape. I chose Escape thinking it would be nice relaxing music but it was a track of Toto Looking Glass Earth Wind Fire etc. NOT relaxing at all. She started the massage by using these odd erratic wiping motions with her hands and then began taking some kind of hard object and pressing as deeply as possible into my back. She spoke fragmented English and all I could understand was sorry sorry. I ended up having to INSIST that she stop so I could get dressed and leave the room. I was scheduled for an hour and only did maybe 15 minutes and that included getting undressed dressed. This hotel is still my favorite in the area but I will definitely seek a reputable massage next time.

Above the Rest. Beautiful hotel inside and out. can not beat the area walking distances to anything you could possibly want shopping dining entertainment. Hotel is very clean and above well kept. The rooms were above clean and we had all the space we needed. They clean everything top to bottom. Really impressed. Staff was friendly and helpful. Met a wonderful server during breakfast who went above an beyond every time we saw her. They offer a nice pool and work out room valet parking if wanted. Due to the central location the parking lot can fill up with people not staying at the hotel. Great place look forward to staying again.

Great experience. I travel to Columbus Ohio once a month for a week and have stayed at a few hotels. However the Hilton is by far one of the nicest hotels and provides exceptional service. The rooms are clean the staff is extremely friendly and it is easy to get to.

Excellent Facility With Some Disruption Due to Ongoing Renovation. we have stayed at this well run hotel on a number of occasions. The hotel is very conveniently located. It is basically part of the Easton shopping area where it is easy to walk around and there are ample restaurants and shops. If you are flying it is also a short ride to the airport. There is both free parking outside and a large garage if you want to park inside. They also have valet parking for something like 14 but unles there is some particular concern I would save the money and just grab a spot nearby. My room was comfortable and well designed. Wi Fi is included in the price and was good for routine web browsing and emails. You can upgrade to faster speeds if you want and I think you can also get the faster speed if you are at some level of the Hilton rewards program. The room is finished with higher quality materials. There were ample plugs at the desk area. My bathroom had a large walk in shower no tub in my case. One neat feature is the mirror which has lighting all around and is heated in some fashion so it would not fog over. I had a couple of quibbles that caused me not to rate this as a 5. First the main areas of the hotel are currently under renovation. You actually have to come in on one side through a kind of sports bar and they check you in at a temporary facility. I understand that the renovations will be completed in November so when you arrive this may no longer be an issue. We also had indifferent service at the sports bar one evening. The good news here is that there are many good restaurants just across the street and it is an easy walk to at least a dozen other places. Incidentally my other interactions with the hotel staff were positive.

Hilton Easton Ohio. The staff was helpful happy to see us and extremely engaging with our family. Our stay was only for 4 days but each morning nite the staff provided us with everything needed for the day from a glass of water to umbrellas in the rain. Although the fitness center pool lobby was under construction the staff ensured us every accommodation.

12th year of meeting 14 college friends for Thanksgiving weekend at the Hilton. All my friends have enjoyed the yearly weekend at the Hilton To open the holiday season for the past 14 years The staff was excellent as always but the hotel was under remodeling which greatly interfered with our stay no dinning room no fireplaces etc.

We stayed three nights for a conference. We upgraded our room to the concierge level paying more money without knowing that the hotel was undergoing a remodeling process and they did not offer the concierge room service. They gave few coffee tickets and free valet parking in compensation of not providing the concierge reception service. We did not use the coffee tickets because the conference provided coffee every morning anyway. We used the valet parking but we did not need it because the public parking was available at few steps away from the valet parking. It would have been a good business practice if they told us at the time of reservation and upgrade that the hotel is undergoing a remodeling process and they would replace the concierge room service with coffee tickets and the valet parking.

Experienced Second Issue in less than 1 year. We stayed at the Hilton Easton on Sunday night. I reserved the room through the Hilton ap. We showed up before the 4 pm check in time and visited the front desk to see if we could be placed on the early check in list which we were. Around 3 pm we received notification that our room was ready and my husband went back to the front desk to obtain our room key. I tried several times on Sunday night to turn the temperature down in the room. it said it was 70 degrees and I set the air to 60. The temperature would not go below 70. This never changed. Monday morning we had planned on getting ready and meeting some friends for breakfast and doing a little shopping before heading home. We decided to sleep in a little and we are getting ready around 9 am when the fan on our air shut off and the lights went off. My husband called down to the front desk and was told that this was a KNOWN power outage that would last until 1AM and we should have been notified ahead of time. First of all we had visited the front desk twice at check in and were never notified. Then they asked if we received a notification under our door. Nope nothing received. We packed up and left. I just can not believe a hotel of this level would not notify its guests. Ridiculous. This is the second issue we have had at this hotel I Less than a year August 2016 toilet issues that were never resolved over 3 DAYS. Needless to say we come to Easton and stay 3 4 times each year and will gladly be staying at the Courtyard by Mariot.

Reservation and Overboked. My company had made me a guaranteed reservation 2 12 weeks before a work conference. I went to check in at 1030 pm and was met by the desk clerk who stated that since my reservation did not have a Hilton Honors Reward number that her manager had decided to give my room away and make me walk. They were paying for me to go to a Hampton Inn that was 20 minutes further away from the conference. It is this Hamptons policy to overbok. Very Frustrating.

2 hours and still waiting on towels. Called over 2 hours ago asking for towels. Was told they ’d be right up. Waited 30 minutes and called again was told they were busy but they ’d be up. Waited another 15 minutes total of 45 min now and called again was told someone was on their way. After and hour I called again and was told they are busy and the front desk hung up on me. Mind you I was told previously my towels were on the way. It ’s been TWO HOURS Waiting and still no towels delivered. Upon arrival I was told parking is 8 per day. When I indicated it is listed as free on trip advisor the front desk lady told me she ’d check but my credit card would probably still be billed. I had to go down a second time show another person the trip advisor screen in order to get my free parking. For the amount it cost to stay here I would expect better treatment.

The only thing that would sway my review is that the hotel staff charged my hotel room for charges that were meant for another room. Receipt showed that other room but hotel staff charged my room. Thank goodness I questioned it and got the charges removed immediately. Staff may want to be careful when charging things to rooms.
Good. Receptionist in evening did not give me good info about getting into airport in morning. In morning the receptionist was fantastic. Thank goodness for her.

Family vacation. The staff of the hotel is amazing but the rooms leave a lot to be desired. Definitely not worth the price. If your hungry use Door Dash the food from room service is horrible. I would avoid this hotel unles you get it for a really good price.

First of all kudos to the hotel for getting us a room as we attended a conference and booked quite late in the game. Check in valet and bellhop were all great. Room was nice large comfortable we were in 642 –. junior suite I believe. Cleaning service was great the entire time. Only issue with the room is that it was HOT. Several of my colleagues said similar things about their rooms. Thermostat was set to 68 and read 73. We turned it down to 64 and it still did nothing. I think there was only one tiny corner vent in the room. Sleeping was pretty uncomfortable. We meant to say something the second night but it got late and two had fallen asleep so we never did until checkout. The location is excellent. Bartenders were great and attentive. My main issue was the food service staff. the meals were mediocre at best. I host a lot of events at hotels and I ’ve seen much better. The plated lunch we had one day that consisted of soup and salad took FOREVER. The tomato soup was cold. The chicken Cesar salad was just not good. Service was slow. Then the plates breakfast the last day was a bad experience also. Food was n’t good. But what was most strange was that the servers were serving guests as soon as they arrived at their table or so it appeared as people were arriving at different times. My friend and I sat there for ten min with no food. Our roommates joined us and then we sat there another 15 min so 25 altogether and had to ask for our breakfast they had plenty of breakfast plates covered and waiting on the side. Then they serve my friend and I our plates. We did n’t want to start eating until everyone was served but our roommates never got their plates. We told one guy they needed them. He brought one and said he needed to get more. He comes back with a tray of fresh plated breakfasts then proceeds to distribute them to other tables. we tell another lady and she kind of ignored us until we finally asked AGAIN and she said “ oh they need breakfast too ”. Frustrating. And our food was cold. Plus they brought out plain eggs and potatoes with no ketchup. Just blah and seemed to be very disjointed.

Not responsive to room problems. I stayed here three nights for a conference. The hotel is nice enough and is adjacent to shopping and restaurants. The fitness room is a little small I got the last treadmill one morning. There is a good makeup mirror in the room which I always appreciate. One of my rooms see below had bathrobes and a nightlight the other didn’t. I had a problem my first night however that was n’t really resolved to my satisfaction. The toilet in my room was malfunctioning and kept running and running. It was very loud and kept stopping and starting keeping me from sleeping. I called the front desk and eventually someone came to fix it after I ’d already lost sleep. It was better briefly but then started up again. I slept as best I could I ’m typically a very heavy sleeper and called again in the morning. Again I was assured it would be fixed. I came back to my room at 2 pm and it was still malfunctioning. My room was also loud because I was in an adjoining room and I could distinctly hear conversation and such from the next room. I decided at this point to complain again and request a new room. It took a little bit but I was given a different room non adjoining working toilet which was quiet and just fine for the next two nights. At check out I was asked if everything had been good with my stay by the very staff person who had changed my room and I reminded him of the problems I had had the first night. He told me he ’d give me some extra points for my problems but honestly I did n’t need extra points I just wanted an apology for the problems with my first room.

Great Overnight Stay. I had a great experience staying at this property before an early morning flight. The location is excellent as there are plenty of shops and restaurants literally across the street. Korey and Tyler at the hotel bar were entertaining and great. The front desk staff were super helpful and one of the few times I was recognized as a Diamond member and offered an upgrade. The only downside was that my A C did not work. After a service call and a visit by a technician it still did not cool the room. Normally this would not have been so bad but the heat outside was in the mid 90s this day so the room stayed pushing 80. Aside from the A C issue I had stay here again.
